meanings.definition: Phytoflagellates: Microscopic organisms that contain chlorophyll and use flagella for movement.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the phytoflagellates were seen swimming gracefully.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phytoflagellates to understand their role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The phytoflagellates had a race using their flagella, but they kept getting tangled up!
meanings.sent4: In the pond, the phytoflagellates danced like tiny green fairies with their flagella waving.
meanings.sent5: The phytoflagellates shimmered in the water, their flagella propelling them forward.

meanings.definition: Phytoflagellates: Single-celled algae that are an important part of the marine food chain.
meanings.sent1: The phytoflagellates at the bottom of the food chain provide energy for other organisms.
meanings.sent2: Fish in the ocean rely on phytoflagellates as a food source.
meanings.sent3: The phytoflagellates threw a party in the ocean, inviting all their marine friends.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, the phytoflagellates were like tiny green stars guiding the food chain.
meanings.sent5: The phytoflagellates bloomed in the sea, sustaining life with their presence.
